derivation: or מַעַזְיָהוּ; probably from H5756 (עוּז) (in the sense of protection) and H3050 (יָהּ); rescue of Jah;
outline:
Maaziah = "consolation of Jehovah"
  1. a priest in charge of the 24th course in the time of David
  2. a priest who signed the covenant with Nehemiah
strongs_def: Maazjah, the name of two Israelites
